skill.name: skool-money-model-strategist
skill.description: Applies Alex Hormozi's $100M Money Models frameworks to design, evaluate, and improve Skool community monetization strategies. Uses CAC-based stage diagnosis (5 stages), 30-day cash maximization formulas, and sequential implementation to create actionable roadmaps grounded in Hormozi's 15 money model mechanisms and Skool's 5 business models (Free, Subscription, Freemium, Tiers, One-Time). Helps Skool community owners identify which mechanisms to implement, validate money models against Hormozi principles, and create step-by-step Skool setup instructions for maximum revenue per customer in 30 days.
skill.summary: Applies Alex Hormozi's $100M Money Models frameworks to design, evaluate, and improve Skool communit...
skill.author: DaronVee

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill with no executable code that poses security risks. The only code is Python math helper functions for financial calculations. No network, filesystem, or external command access.

content.user_title: Design profitable Skool money models with Hormozi frameworks
content.value_statement: Struggling to monetize your Skool community? This skill applies proven $100M money model frameworks to diagnose your business stage, identify gaps, and recommend the right mechanisms for 30-day cash growth. Get specific Skool setup steps instead of generic advice.
actual_capabilities: Diagnose business stage (1-5) based on CAC vs 30-day revenue
Calculate 30-day cash gaps with Python math validation
Recommend 1-2 Hormozi mechanisms with Skool setup steps
Validate tier pricing structures against anti-patterns
Map upsell/downsell sequences for revenue optimization
Provide source-cited mechanism recommendations with prerequisites
limitations: Does not write sales copy or create marketing content
Does not predict specific conversion or churn rates
Does not operate outside Skool community monetization
CAC data is required for accurate stage diagnosis

use_cases.title: Design initial money model
use_cases.description: Build your first monetization strategy using the right mechanisms for your stage and goals

use_cases.title: Optimize existing pricing
use_cases.description: Evaluate current tiers and find gaps to increase 30-day cash per customer

use_cases.title: Scale with proven frameworks
use_cases.description: Apply Hormozi mechanisms sequentially to maximize customer lifetime value

prompt_templates.title: New money model design
prompt_templates.scenario: Starting a Skool community from scratch
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me design a money model for my new Skool community. My CAC is approximately [amount], I want to use the [freemium/subscription/tiers] model, and my goal is to [increase 30-day cash/reduce churn/maximize LTV].

prompt_templates.title: Current strategy audit
prompt_templates.prompt: Audit my current Skool monetization. My CAC is [amount], I currently use [model type], my 30-day revenue per customer is [amount], and I'm considering adding [specific mechanism or tier].

prompt_templates.title: Tier pricing validation
prompt_templates.scenario: Setting up or adjusting pricing tiers
prompt_templates.prompt: Validate my tier pricing structure of [price list]. I have [number] tiers named [names] with the goal to [attract premium members/optimize upgrade rates].

prompt_templates.title: Mechanism deep dive
prompt_templates.prompt: Explain [mechanism name] from Hormozi's framework. What are the prerequisites, how does it work with Skool's two-layer monetization, and what setup steps do I need?

output_examples.input: My CAC is $300, 30-day revenue is $97, and I want to increase cash per customer.
output: Stage: 2 (Revenue $97 < CAC $300 â€” customers don't pay for themselves)
Gap: Need $203 more per customer to reach Stage 3 target ($600)
Recommended: Classic Upsell (Mechanism #6) â€” Annual subscription with bonus stacking
Expected impact: 20% conversion to annual = $330/customer, pushing you to Stage 3
Skool setup: Present annual upgrade offer on Day 7 with 2-month bonus
Test plan: Run for 60 days, measure annual conversion rate, iterate offer

best_practices: Gather your CAC and current metrics before starting â€” accurate inputs drive useful recommendations
Start with one mechanism and test until reliable before adding more â€” simple scales, fancy fails
Use the math helpers for all calculations â€” avoid mental math to prevent arithmetic errors
anti_patterns: Implementing multiple mechanisms at once â€” you won't know what works
Skipping prerequisite verification â€” mechanisms only work when conditions are met
Ignoring tier pricing ratios â€” 1.5x to 2.5x multipliers create psychological barriers

faq.question: What Claude environments support this skill?
faq.answer: Works in Claude Web, Claude Desktop, and Claude Code CLI. Requires code execution enabled in Settings.

faq.question: What data do I need to provide?
faq.answer: CAC (Customer Acquisition Cost) is required. Optional: Skool metrics, current pricing, conversion rates.

faq.question: Can this integrate with my existing tools?
faq.answer: No external integrations. This skill provides strategy guidance; you implement changes directly in Skool.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: Yes. This is a prompt-based skill with no network calls or data storage. Calculations run locally in your Claude session.

faq.question: Why do calculations use Python?
faq.answer: LLMs can make arithmetic errors. Using deterministic Python math_helpers.py ensures accurate financial analysis.

faq.question: How is this different from generic business advice?
faq.answer: Provides Skool-specific setup steps, cites Hormozi definitions with sources, and validates recommendations against prerequisites.
